turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Donate to Save the Children, please. Think about those poor kids.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Well tell me a little bit more about the charity.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: It's really all in the name. You have a moral responsibility.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: A lot of charities are just a name and they don't do what they promise. How do I know my money will go where it supposed to?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: They're a world-famous trustworthy charity. If they were fraudulent or misallocating funds, surely there'd have been a scandal.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Ok. So why do they deserve my money as opposed to other charities like St Judes or the Red Cross>

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Of course you can donate to other charities. It's not necessarily a zero-sum game. I can tell you, however, that Save the Children is, in a way, more immediate in helping people (as opposed to fighting disease like St Jude's) and delivers services similar to the Red Cross, but directed toward children. So, please: think of the children!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Do they help kids in the US? I like to help people that are close to home.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Their assistance is directed toward children in developing countries, where, unlike most of the US, children are totally deprived of opportunity and basic services. Though you, being the generous person you are, like helping those at home, is there a reason not to help children abroad?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I don't mind helping those abroad. But there are a lot kids here in the US who deal with poverty.  So it's not that I don't care about the children elsewhere, just want to help those at home first.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: So we'll agree then: you can do both!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Well how do i make a donation to them?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: You can refer to Save the Children's website to gather more information if you like to: http:// URL

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: well if you aren't going to help me out with information and make it easy on me by helping with info, i'm not sure if you really care

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Of course I care. Let me get that information for you now...

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Thanks I would appreciate your help. People are more likely to donate when they are comfortable and feel like it is good organization.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: On the Save the Children Website, there\'s a "Donate Now!" button, as well as large swaths of information regarding their activity, that is, how they use the money!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Ok thank you. Yes I believe I will donate. I do think it is a good cause.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Thank you. You're helping a lot of good kids who really, really need it.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: You are welcome.  Even though I can't donate much, at least it will do some good.
